headline: A Look at Invesco’s (IVZ) Valuation After Strong Quarterly Earnings and Dividend Confirmation
summary: Invesco just released its third quarter results, showing revenue and earnings well ahead of market forecasts. The company also announced increases in assets under management and confirmed both common and preferred dividend payouts. See our latest analysis for Invesco. It has been a strong period for Invesco, with several positive headlines highlighting the company’s momentum. headline: Invesco (NYSE:IVZ) Reports Upbeat Q3
summary: Asset management firm Invesco (NYSE:IVZ) reported Q3 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 48.5% year on year to $1.64 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.61 per share was 39% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Invesco (NYSE:IVZ) Reports Upbeat Q3
raw.summary: Asset management firm Invesco (NYSE:IVZ) reported Q3 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 48.5% year on year to $1.64 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.61 per share was 39% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Invesco: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: ATLANTA (AP) — Invesco PLC (IVZ) on Tuesday reported third-quarter net income of $345.7 million. On a per-share basis, the Atlanta-based company said it had net income of 66 cents. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were 61 cents per share.

headline: Did the QQQ Conversion Vote Delay Just Shift Invesco's (IVZ) Investment Narrative?
summary: In the past week, Invesco announced the postponement of a critical shareholder vote on converting its flagship QQQ fund from a unit investment trust to an open-ended ETF, rescheduling the meeting for December 5 to allow more time to achieve the required quorum. The proposed conversion could modernize the QQQ structure, lower investor costs, and generate substantial additional annual revenue for Invesco while allowing the company to collect direct investment-management fees. We'll review how...
